title: HTTP problem opening Intel management web interface (MEB) pop-up
author: Shinybro
body_snippet:
When trying to open the Intel management web interface of a PC on port 16992 the 2 possible options, Internet Explorer and Edge Chromium don't work.
I'm using the nightly build 1.77.2 on Windows 11.

Normally when you open the page at http://ip-addres:16992 you get a screen with a login button.
Clicking the login button opens a pop-up where you can enter a login and password.

When doing this in mRemoteNG v1.77.2 the following happens:

Using Internet Explorer:
- The page opens with the...

comments.snippet: To test such need emulate Intel management web interface - is it any documentation to do such?
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet:
Hi Dimitrij,

This Intel management interface is available on many PC's.
It is called vPro and has to be enabled in the BIOS.
Once enabled you can set it up when the PC is booting, similar to going into setup.
I've attached some explanation which can help you setting it up.

I hope this can help you.

Kind regards,

Bart

Verzonden: woensdag 20 april 2022 10:33

comments.snippet: for the edge chromium part, #2428 comments solved it for me. Sorry about crossposting, but I searched way too long on this.
comments.author: TrueOsiris

comments.snippet:
Triage refresh (P4 version-label debt): this issue is tagged with legacy version labels. Please retest on the latest build (fork v1.79.x or upstream dev), then share reproducible steps and expected vs actual behavior. If still valid, keep open and relabel to current triage scope (for example Need 2 check). If fixed, close with resolution.

Current legacy version labels: 1.77.3
comments.author: robertpopa22
